# The `X86InterleavedAccessGroup` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class holds necessary information to represent an interleaved access group and supports utilities to lower the group into X86-specific instructions/intrinsics. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class anonymous_namespace{X86InterleavedAccess.cpp}::X86InterleavedAccessGroup</CodeBlock>

## Public Constructors Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  name={<><a href="#ae9baadcb34d80f6467fcd01c3f513b60">X86InterleavedAccessGroup</a> (Instruction &#42;I, ArrayRef&lt; ShuffleVectorInst &#42; &gt; Shuffs, ArrayRef&lt; unsigned &gt; Ind, const unsigned F, const X86Subtarget &amp;STarget, IRBuilder&lt;&gt; &amp;B)</>}>
In order to form an interleaved access group <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-x86interleavedaccess-cpp-/x86interleavedaccessgroup">X86InterleavedAccessGroup</a> requires a wide-load instruction <code>&#39;I&#39;</code>, a group of interleaved-vectors <code>Shuffs</code>, reference to the first indices of each interleaved-vector <code>&#39;Ind&#39;</code> and the interleaving stride factor <code>F</code>. <a href="#ae9baadcb34d80f6467fcd01c3f513b60">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

## Description {#details}

This class holds necessary information to represent an interleaved access group and supports utilities to lower the group into X86-specific instructions/intrinsics.

E.g. A group of interleaving access loads (Factor = 2; accessing every other element) wide.vec = load &lt;8 x i32&gt;, &lt;8 x i32&gt;&#42; ptr v0 = shuffle &lt;8 x i32&gt; wide.vec, &lt;8 x i32&gt; poison, &lt;0, 2, 4, 6&gt; v1 = shuffle &lt;8 x i32&gt; wide.vec, &lt;8 x i32&gt; poison, &lt;1, 3, 5, 7&gt;

Definition at line 46 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86interleavedaccess-cpp">X86InterleavedAccess.cpp</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### X86InterleavedAccessGroup() {#ae9baadcb34d80f6467fcd01c3f513b60}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;X86InterleavedAccess.cpp&#125;::X86InterleavedAccessGroup::X86InterleavedAccessGroup (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/shufflevectorinst">ShuffleVectorInst</a> &#42; &gt; Shuffs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; Ind, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> unsigned F, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/x86subtarget">X86Subtarget</a> &amp; STarget, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilder">IRBuilder</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; B)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "explicit"]}>
In order to form an interleaved access group <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-x86interleavedaccess-cpp-/x86interleavedaccessgroup">X86InterleavedAccessGroup</a> requires a wide-load instruction <code>&#39;I&#39;</code>, a group of interleaved-vectors <code>Shuffs</code>, reference to the first indices of each interleaved-vector <code>&#39;Ind&#39;</code> and the interleaving stride factor <code>F</code>.

In order to generate X86-specific instructions/intrinsics it also requires the underlying target information <code>STarget</code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86interleavedaccess-cpp/#l00106">106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86interleavedaccess-cpp">X86InterleavedAccess.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### transpose&#95;4x4() {#ae212ec75f34f93b61b9b844d91d88cbf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void X86InterleavedAccessGroup::transpose&#95;4x4 (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; InputVectors, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; TransposedMatrix)</>}>
Performs matrix transposition on a 4x4 matrix <code>InputVectors</code> and returns the transposed-vectors in <code>TransposedVectors</code>.

E.g. InputVectors: In-V0 = p1, p2, p3, p4 In-V1 = q1, q2, q3, q4 In-V2 = r1, r2, r3, r4 In-V3 = s1, s2, s3, s4 OutputVectors: Out-V0 = p1, q1, r1, s1 Out-V1 = p2, q2, r2, s2 Out-V2 = p3, q3, r3, s3 Out-V3 = P4, q4, r4, s4

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86interleavedaccess-cpp/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86interleavedaccess-cpp">X86InterleavedAccess.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
